title: Continuance Of Certain Federal Advisory Committees

enrichment.summary: This executive order extends the duration of various federal advisory committees until September 30, 2015, ensuring their continued operation and guidance on important governmental matters. It also modifies the membership and functions of certain committees, especially the National Infrastructure Advisory Council, to better advise the President on security, resilience, and other key issues.
potential_concerns: The expanded role and membership changes to the National Infrastructure Advisory Council could raise concerns about adequate representation and influence of tribal governments in critical infrastructure decisions.
Including private sector corporate executives with security clearances may create conflicts of interest between public security goals and business priorities.

Small business owners involved in critical infrastructure sectors might face increased pressure or scrutiny as private-public partnerships in security intensify under the advisory committee's guidance.

The coordination required among multiple federal advisory committees might lead to overlap and inefficiencies, potentially diluting the effectiveness of advice benefiting corporate executives and security clearance holders.
